title: The Melodic Triumphs of Peggy Scott
summary: Peggy Scott, a 26-year-old music arranger and teacher, discovers her superpower of manipulating emotions through music, facing and overcoming various challenges throughout a week.
summaryGerman: Peggy Scott, eine 26-jährige Musikarrangeurin und Lehrerin, entdeckt ihre Superkraft, Emotionen durch Musik zu manipulieren, und stellt sich im Laufe einer Woche verschiedenen Herausforderungen.
summaryDutch: Peggy Scott, een 26-jarige muziekarrangeur en leraar, ontdekt haar superkracht om emoties te manipuleren door middel van muziek, en overwint verschillende uitdagingen gedurende een week.
summaryFrench: Peggy Scott, une arrangeuse et enseignante de musique de 26 ans, découvre son super pouvoir de manipulation des émotions à travers la musique, faisant face et surmontant divers défis tout au long d'une semaine.

story.text: Peggy Scott wakes feeling energetic, as she prepares a new syllabus integrating music with emotional wellness for her students.
During a school assembly, Peggy uses her music to calm a chaotic situation, realizing her power can influence moods.
Peggy experiments further with her powers but faces doubts and anxiety about the ethical implications of her abilities.
Inspired, Peggy spends the day composing a piece that she feels could help people overcome fear.
At a local community event, Peggy plays her new composition, witnessing firsthand its powerful effect on the audience’s emotions.
The news of her talent spreads, and Peggy is invited to speak at a music therapy conference, feeling a mix of excitement and nervousness.
Peggy reflects on her week, feeling content and motivated to explore her powers responsibly while continuing to teach.

ending: Through her music, Peggy learned that with great power comes great responsibility, and thus she vowed to use her abilities to bring harmony wherever she could.
moral: The true power of music lies in its ability to heal and inspire, demanding careful and compassionate use.
